history.proof: intros Hring. unfold divide, is_ring in Hring. sfirstorder depth: 3.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
S: Set
A: S -> Prop
Mult: S -> S -> S
Add: S -> S -> S
I: S
O: S
Opp: S -> S
v: S -> nat

Goal:
is_ring -> divide O O

Premises:
divide = fun a b : S => A a /\ A b /\ (b = O \/ a <> O /\ (exists q : S, A q /\ b = Mult a q)) : S -> S -> Prop
is_ring = commutativity S Add /\ is_group S A Add O Opp /\ intern S A Mult /\ associativity S Mult /\ distributivity S Add Mult : Prop
VectorDef.fold_right2 : (?A -> ?B -> ?C -> ?C) -> ?C -> forall n : nat, VectorDef.t ?A n -> VectorDef.t ?B n -> ?C where ?A : [S : Set A : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S Mult : S -> S -> S O : S I : S Opp : S -> S v : S -> nat |- Type] ?B : [S : Set A : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S Mult : S -> S -> S O : S I : S Opp : S -> S v : S -> nat |- Type] ?C : [S : Set A : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S Mult : S -> S -> S O : S I : S Opp : S -> S v : S -> nat |- Type]
is_opposite : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> S -> S -> Prop
VectorDef.rect2 : forall P : forall n : nat, VectorDef.t ?A n -> VectorDef.t ?B n -> Type, P 0 (VectorDef.nil ?A) (VectorDef.nil ?B) -> (forall (n : nat) (v1 : VectorDef.t ?A n) (v2 : VectorDef.t ?B n), P n v1 v2 -> forall (a : ?A) (b : ?B), P (Datatypes.S n) (VectorDef.cons ?A a n v1) (VectorDef.cons ?B b n v2)) -> forall (n : nat) (v1 : VectorDef.t ?A n) (v2 : VectorDef.t ?B n), P n v1 v2 where ?A : [S : Set A : S -> Prop Add : S -> S -> S Mult : S -> S -> S O : S I : S Opp : S -> S v : S -> nat |- Type] ?B : [S : Set A : S -> Prop Add : S -> S ->...-> nat |- Type]
opp_unicity : forall (S : Set) (G : S -> Prop) (Add : S -> S -> S) (O : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_group S G Add O Opp -> forall x y : S, is_opposite S G Add O x y -> y = Opp x
distributivity : forall S : Set, (S -> S -> S) -> (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
neutral : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> Prop
opp_opp : forall (S : Set) (G : S -> Prop) (Add : S -> S -> S) (O : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_group S G Add O Opp -> forall x : S, G x -> x = Opp (Opp x)
is_group : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> (S -> S) -> Prop
opposite : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> (S -> S) -> Prop
commutativity : forall S : Set, (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
associativity : forall S : Set, (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
regular_l : forall (S : Set) (G : S -> Prop) (Add : S -> S -> S) (O : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_group S G Add O Opp -> forall y z : S, G y -> G z -> forall x : S, G x -> Add x y = Add x z -> y = z
intern : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> Prop
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments Datatypes.S _%nat_scope
is_unitary_commutative_ring = is_ring /\ commutativity S Mult /\ neutral S A Mult I : Prop
mult_O : is_ring -> forall x : S, A x -> Mult x O = O /\ Mult O x = O
mult_opp_r : is_ring -> forall x y : S, A x -> A y -> Mult x (Opp y) = Opp (Mult x y)
mult_opp_l : is_ring -> forall x y : S, A x -> A y -> Mult (Opp x) y = Opp (Mult x y)
mult_opp_opp : is_ring -> forall x y : S, A x -> A y -> Mult (Opp x) (Opp y) = Mult x y
Ring_polynom.PNSubst1 : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> C * Ring_polynom.Mon -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> nat -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
Ring_polynom.POneSubst : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> C * Ring_polynom.Mon -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> option (Ring_polynom.Pol C)
Ring_polynom.PNSubstL : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C) -> nat -> nat -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
Ring_polynom.PSubstL : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C) -> nat -> option (Ring_polynom.Pol C)
Inductive ascii : Set := Ascii : bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> Ascii.ascii Arguments Ascii.Ascii (_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _)%bool_scope
PeanoNat.Nat.max_case_strong : forall (n m : nat) (P : nat -> Type), (m <= n -> P n) -> (n <= m -> P m) -> P (PeanoNat.Nat.max n m)

```coq
intros Hring.
unfold divide, is_ring in Hring.
destruct Hring as [(Hcommu, (Hgroup, (Hintern, (Hassoc, Hdistrib)))),
                  HcommuMult, Hneutral].
apply regular_l with (y:=O) (z:=O); auto.
Qed.
